test: Can someone tell me why, after installing a software app with Synaptic I cannot see it in the Applications menu, but I can see it in the Applications Configuration Menu?
the Applications Menu Editor i mean
just tick the box then
the powers that  be like to hide things they think are too geeky for Ubuntites ;)
like terminals ;)
sometimes a "killall gnome-panel" makes them appear
the kill all won't bust my setup will it?
no, gnome-panel respawns
thanks
killall foo means "kill all processes of the foo program" - but gnome-panel resurrects itself :)

cool man. Tried that and it has worked for some things like Scribus that was not showing before. Still no sign of 3D Chess though. But thanks for that little gem. So many things to remember with Linux :-)
dpkg -L <packagename> | grep bin
that usually finds a binary
that rocks! I'm really starting to see why command line so good. It is in usr/share
sudo apt-get install apt-howto && apt-howto
It is in usr/lib/menu actually - reading the wrong bit :-)
what will that do?
give you an apt-get howto and open it in your browser :)
how the hell do you guys remember all that?
it's like playing pool - if you waste enough of yourlife doing it you get to know how a bit
enjoy :)
